## we compare performance and the number of weekly activties they submitted.
## compare the performance between the number of weekly participationg
## We first analyse the total number of demographics for the full course
## Measure the demographics between female and male
```{r projectTemplate, include=FALSE}
library(ProjectTemplate)
load.project()
require(gridExtra)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
df_1 = ggplot(data=numberOfTypes(total_enrollments,age_range), aes(y=age_range, x=n, fill = age_range)) + geom_bar(stat="identity") + scale_colour_brewer("Diamond\nclarity")
df_2 = ggplot(data=numberOfTypes(total_enrollments,gender), aes(x=gender, y=n)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", fill = "blue")
df_3 = ggplot(data=numberOfTypes(total_enrollments,region), aes(x=region, y=n)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", fill = "blue")
df_4 = ggplot(data=numberOfTypes(total_enrollments,highest_education_level), aes(y=highest_education_level, x=n)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", fill = "blue")
grid.arrange(df_1, df_2, df_3, df_4, ncol = 2, nrow = 2)
```


```{r, echo=FALSE}
types = c("gender", "region","age_range")
grid.arrange(grobs = plotAvgPerformance(types))

types = c("highest_education_level","employment_status")
grid.arrange(grobs = plotAvgPerformance(types))
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plotPerformanceDist("gender", nrow = 1, ncol = 1, overall = TRUE)
plotPerformanceDist("region", nrow = 1, ncol = 1, overall = TRUE)
plotPerformanceDist("age_range", nrow = 1, ncol = 1, overall = TRUE)
plotPerformanceDist("highest_education_level", nrow = 1, ncol = 1, overall = TRUE)
plotPerformanceDist("employment_status", nrow = 1, ncol = 1, overall = TRUE)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
ggplot(na.omit(performanceVsActivity(total_activties)), aes(y=performance, x=num_of_activties_completed)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```
